ingredients: Freshly crushed black pepper ½ tsp.
methods: Mix well all the marinade ingredients and spread evenly on the sliced paneer. Keep aside for 10 minutes.
Spread mint chutney evenly on the sliced paneer.
Arrange sliced onions and tomatoes on each sliced paneer and cover with the sliced cheese.
Stack each layer of sliced paneer one on top of the other, by repeating the process.
Make a mixture of cream and crushed black pepper and pour over the top layer.
Place the last cheese slice on top, and bake at a moderate temperature for 10 minutes in the oven.
Cut into desired equal sizes.
Serving suggestion: To turn this dish into a non-vegetarian version, substitute paneer with chicken escalops, roll in a roomali roti, and serve hot.

ingredients: For Deep-frying: 1 Banana leaf is needed
methods: Clean coriander leaves, wash well and then chop finely. Keep aside about 2 tablespoon chopped coriander leaves for garnish.
Wash green chillies, remove the stem and then chop.
Combine remaining coriander leaves, green chillies, jaggery, salt, soda-bi-carbonate, turmeric, besan, and oil.
Roll it out into a cylindrical shape of 2 inches in diameter.
Grease the banana leaf with a bit of oil, and roll the dough in it.
Steam it for 15-20 minutes or until done.
Remove, cool, and cut into 1-centimeter slices.
Heat oil to a moderate hot level and deep fry steamed wadi until crisp and light golden brown in color.
Remove, drain off excess oil, sprinkle chopped coriander leaves on top.
Serve hot.

ingredients: 1/2 cup green peas, boiled and mashed
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, mashed green peas, grated paneer, green chilies, and grated ginger.
Add cumin seeds, red chili powder, garam masala, chaat masala, and salt. Mix well to form a dough.
Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into tikkis (patties).
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the tikkis until they are golden brown and crisp on both sides.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.

ingredients: 1 cup urad dal (black gram), soaked for 4-5 hours
methods: Drain the soaked urad dal and grind it into a smooth batter using very little water.
Add chopped green chilies, crushed black peppercorns, cumin seeds, asafoetida, chopped curry leaves, and salt to the batter. Mix well.
Heat oil in a pan for frying.
Wet your hands, take a small portion of the batter, and shape it into a donut-like vada.
Carefully slide the vada into the hot oil and fry until they are golden brown and crisp.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.
In a mixing bowl, combine sliced onions, gram flour, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin seeds, baking soda, and salt.
Add a little water to make a thick batter, ensuring the onions are well coated.
Heat oil in a pan for frying.
Drop spoonfuls of the onion batter into the hot oil and fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or ketchup.

ingredients: 500 grams minced meat (chicken, lamb, or beef)
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine minced meat, chopped onion, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala, breadcrumbs, and salt. Mix well.
Take a small portion of the mixture and shape it onto skewers to form kababs.
Preheat a grill or oven to medium-high heat.
Brush the kababs with oil and grill them until they are cooked and have a nice char on the outside.
Serve hot with mint chutney and naan or roti.

ingredients: 1/4 cup finely chopped spinach or coriander leaves
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine cooked rice, gram flour, chopped onions, chopped spinach or coriander leaves, green chilies, red chili powder, cumin seeds, baking soda, and salt.
Add a little water to make a thick batter.
Heat oil in a pan for frying.
Drop spoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil and fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.
In a mixing bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt.
Add the mutton cubes to the marinade and mix well. Let it marinate for at least 2 hours, or overnight in the refrigerator.
Thread the marinated mutton onto skewers.
Preheat a grill or oven to medium-high heat.
Brush the mutton with oil and grill them until they are cooked and have a nice char on the outside.
Serve hot with mint chutney and naan or roti.
In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, bread crumbs, chopped vegetables, green chilies, ginger paste, chaat masala, cumin powder, and salt.
Mix well to form a dough.
Shape the dough into cutlets.
Heat oil in a pan for frying.
Fry the cutlets until they are golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
Add chopped onions and bell peppers. Sauté until they become soft.
Add diced potatoes and sweet corn kernels. Cook until they turn golden brown.
Season with paprika, cumin powder, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Cook for a few more minutes until the flavors meld.
Serve hot as a side dish or snack.

ingredients: 1 cup chana dal (split chickpeas), soaked for 3-4 hours
methods: Drain the soaked chana dal and grind it into a coarse paste without adding water.
In a mixing bowl, combine the chana dal paste, ground peanuts, chopped onions, green chilies, ginger paste, chaat masala, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Shape the mixture into tikke (patties).
Heat oil in a pan for frying.
Fry the tikke until they are golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Serve hot with mint chutney.
In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, cornflour, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, and salt.
Dip the fish fillets in the flour mixture, coating them evenly.
Heat oil in a pan for frying.
Fry the fish fillets until they are crispy and golden brown.
Serve hot with tartar sauce or lemon wedges.
In a large mixing bowl, combine puffed rice, chopped onions, chopped tomatoes, chopped cucumber, diced potatoes, and sev.
Add tamarind chutney, green chutney, chaat masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Toss everything together until well mixed.
Serve immediately as a delicious snack.
For the dough, combine all-purpose flour, vegetable oil, and salt in a bowl.
Add water gradually and knead into a smooth and stiff dough. Cover with a damp cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes.
For the filling, heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds.
Add ginger paste and garlic paste. Sauté until the raw smell disappears.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for a few minutes.
Add mashed potatoes and boiled green peas. Mix well and cook until the filling is dry. Let it cool.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll each ball into a thin oval shape.
Cut the oval in half to create two semi-circles.
Fold each semi-circle into a cone shape and seal the edges with water.
Fill each cone with the potato-pea filling and seal the open edge to form a triangle shape.
Heat oil for deep frying and fry the samosas until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.
In a blender, combine fresh coriander leaves, fresh mint leaves, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, and yogurt. Blend into a smooth green marinade.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, chaat masala, lemon juice, and salt to the marinade. Mix well.
Thread the paneer cubes onto skewers and coat them with the green marinade.
Preheat a grill or oven to medium-high heat.
Brush the paneer with oil and grill them until they are charred and cooked.
Serve hot with mint chutney.

ingredients: 500 grams boneless chicken, cut into cubes
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt.
Add the chicken cubes to the marinade and mix well. Let it marinate for at least 2 hours, or overnight in the refrigerator.
Thread the marinated chicken onto skewers.
Preheat a grill or oven to medium-high heat.
Brush the chicken with oil and grill them until they are cooked and have a nice char on the outside.
Serve hot with mint chutney and naan or roti.
Wash colocasia leaves and pat them dry. Remove the central vein from each leaf.
In a bowl, combine gram flour, tamarind pulp, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, sugar, salt, and 1 tablespoon of oil. Mix into a smooth paste.
Spread the gram flour paste evenly on the back side of each colocasia leaf.
Roll up each leaf tightly to form a cylinder.
Steam the rolled leaves for about 20-25 minutes or until they are cooked.
Let them cool and then slice into rounds.
In a pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil and add mustard seeds and sesame seeds. Sauté until they splutter.
Add the sliced colocasia rolls and sauté until they turn crispy and golden brown.
Serve hot as a snack or side dish.
In a mixing bowl, combine besan, yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, asafoetida, and salt to make a smooth batter.
Pour the batter into a non-stick pan and cook on low heat. Stir continuously until it thickens and leaves the sides of the pan.
Spread the cooked mixture on a greased surface while it's still hot.
Let it cool for a few minutes, and then cut it into strips.
Roll each strip tightly to form khandvi rolls.
In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until they splutter.
Pour the tempering over the khandvi rolls.
Garnish with grated coconut, chopped cilantro, and sesame seeds.
Serve as a delightful snack or appetizer.

ingredients: 200 grams paneer (cottage cheese), cut into cubes
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, red chili powder, turmeric powder, ajwain, baking soda, and salt.
Add water gradually to make a thick batter.
Dip paneer cubes into the batter and deep fry them until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or ketchup.
Wash and soak sabudana in water for 4-5 hours or until they become soft and fluffy.
In a mixing bowl, combine soaked sabudana, mashed potatoes, green chilies, coarsely ground peanuts, cumin seeds, sugar, and salt.
Shape the mixture into round wadas.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the wadas until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with yogurt or chutney.

ingredients: 1 cup chana dal (split chickpeas), soaked for 3-4 hours
methods: Drain the soaked chana dal and grind it into a coarse paste without adding water.
In a mixing bowl, combine the chana dal paste, chopped green chilies, ginger paste, cumin seeds, asafoetida, chopped curry leaves, and salt.
Shape the mixture into bhajiya (patties).
Heat oil in a pan for frying.
Fry the bhajiya until they are golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Serve hot with chutney.
For the Puris, mix semolina, all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, and enough water to make a stiff dough.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into puris.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the puris until they puff up and turn golden brown.
For the Pani, blend mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chilies, ginger, and lemon juice into a smooth paste.
Add roasted cumin powder, black salt, tamarind paste, and salt. Mix well with water to make the spicy pani.
To assemble, make a hole in each puri and fill it with mashed potatoes, boiled black chickpeas, tamarind chutney, and green chutney.
Dip the filled puris into the spicy pani and garnish with sev.
Serve immediately.
For the Dough, mix besan, all-purpose flour, red chili powder, turmeric powder, asafoetida, salt, and oil.
Add water gradually and knead into a smooth and stiff dough.
For the Filling, dry roast grated coconut, sesame seeds, and poppy seeds until they turn golden brown.
Remove from heat and add powdered sugar, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into thin circles.
Spread the filling mixture evenly on each circle and roll them into a tight cylinder.
Cut the cylinder into small rounds.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the rounds until they turn golden brown and crispy.
Serve as a savory snack.

ingredients: Oil for greasing the idli molds
methods: In a pan, dry roast semolina until it turns light brown. Remove from heat and let it cool.
In another pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, grated ginger, and asafoetida. Sauté until the dals turn golden brown.
Add water, yogurt, roasted semolina, baking soda, and salt. Mix well to form a thick batter.
Grease the idli molds with oil and pour the batter into them.
Steam the idlis for 15-20 minutes or until they are cooked.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

ingredients: 500 grams fish fillets, boneless and skinless
methods: Boil the fish fillets until they are cooked and flaky. Drain and let them cool.

In a mixing bowl, combine boiled and mashed potatoes, finely chopped onion, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt.
Add the boiled and flaked fish to the mixture and mix well.
Shape the mixture into chops or patties.
Coat the chops with bread crumbs.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the chops until they are golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot as a snack or appetizer.

ingredients: 1 cup chana dal (split chickpeas), soaked for 3-4 hours
methods: Drain the soaked chana dal and grind it into a coarse paste without adding water.

In a pressure cooker, combine minced meat, finely chopped onions, green chilies, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, salt, and the ground chana dal paste.
Add enough water to cover the ingredients and pressure cook for 3-4 whistles or until the meat is tender and cooked.
Remove from heat and let it cool.
Shape the mixture into kababs or balls.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the kababs until they are browned and cooked.
Serve hot with mint chutney.

ingredients: 1/2 cup yellow moong dal (split yellow gram), soaked for 4-5 hours
methods: For the Outer Covering, mix all-purpose flour, ghee, and a pinch of salt in a bowl.
Add water gradually and knead into a smooth dough. Cover with a damp cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes.
For the Filling, grind soaked yellow moong dal into a coarse paste without adding water.
Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds and fennel seeds.
Add ginger paste, green chili paste, red chili powder, garam masala, dry mango powder, and salt. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add the ground moong dal mixture and cook until it becomes dry and the mixture holds together.
Divide the dough and filling into small portions.
Roll each portion of dough into a small circle and place a portion of filling in the center.
Seal the edges and shape it into a round kachori.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the kachoris until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or aloo sabzi.

ingredients: 1 cup green peas, boiled and mashed

Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the cutlets until they are golden brown on both sides.

Add the drained poha and mix well. Cook for a few minutes until heated through.
Garnish with roasted peanuts and fresh coriander leaves.
Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 cup dried white peas (vatana), soaked overnight
methods: For Ragda:
Pressure cook the soaked white peas until soft and mushy.
Heat oil in a pan and add asafoetida. Sauté for a few seconds.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin-coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add the cooked white peas and simmer for a few minutes until the ragda thickens.
For Pattice:
In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, bread crumbs, red chili powder, and chaat masala.
Shape the mixture into patties and shallow fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve the ragda topped with pattice.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, capsicum), boiled and mashed
methods: Heat oil and butter in a pan. Add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Sauté until they splutter.
Add chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until the onions turn translucent.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and pav bhaji masala. Mix well.
Add mashed potatoes and mixed vegetables. Mash and mix everything together.
Add salt and simmer for a few minutes until the bhaji is well cooked.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Toast the pav with a little butter on a griddle.
Serve the bhaji with toasted pav.
Wash and soak rice, urad dal, toor dal, chana dal, and fenugreek seeds together for 6-8 hours.
Grind into a smooth batter using water as needed. The batter should be of pouring consistency.
Add salt and mix well. Allow it to ferment for 8-10 hours or overnight.
Heat a griddle or tava and grease it with a little oil.
Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it into a circle. Sprinkle chopped onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and fresh coriander leaves on top.
Drizzle a little oil around the edges and cook until the uttapa is golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sambar.
Wash and soak urad dal and moong dal together for 4-6 hours.
Grind into a smooth batter using water as needed. The batter should be fluffy and light.
Add salt and mix well.
Heat oil in a pan. Wet your hands and take a small portion of the batter. Flatten it and make a hole in the center. Gently slide it into the hot oil.
Fry until they turn golden brown and crispy. Remove and drain on paper towels.
Soak the fried vadas in water for 20-30 minutes. Squeeze out the water gently.
Arrange the vadas in a serving dish. Pour beaten yogurt on top.
Drizzle tamarind chutney, mint chutney, cumin seeds, asafoetida, chopped green chilies, and grated ginger on top.
Serve chilled.
In a bowl, beat the eggs until well mixed. Add grated cheese, black pepper powder, and salt. Mix well.
Heat butter in a pan. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and spread it evenly.
Cook on low heat until the edges start to lift and the omelette is set.
Fold the omelette in half and serve hot.
Wash and peel the lotus root slices. Pat them dry with a kitchen towel.
In a bowl, mix rice flour, red chili powder, asafoetida, and salt with water to form a smooth batter.
Dip the lotus root slices in the batter and deep fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot as a crispy snack.
In a bowl, combine gram flour, red chili powder, asafoetida, and salt.
Add water gradually to form a smooth batter.
Dip the mushroom slices in the batter and deep fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.
In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, powdered sugar, cardamom powder, and a pinch of salt.
Add ghee and mix until the mixture resembles bread crumbs.
Gradually add water and knead into a stiff dough.
Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into cylindrical shapes.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the cylindrical shapes until they are golden brown.
Remove and drain on paper towels.
Store in an airtight container.
In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, gram flour, powdered sugar, cardamom powder, and baking soda.
Add ghee and knead into a smooth dough.
Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into round cookies.
Place chopped nuts on top of each cookie and press gently.
Grease a baking tray and arrange the cookies on it.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 20-25 minutes or until they turn golden brown.
Remove and let them cool before serving.

ingredients: Cream cheese or soft cheese spread
methods: Lay out a salami slice on a clean surface.
Spread a layer of cream cheese or soft cheese spread on the salami slice.
Place a pickled jalapeño slice (if using) and a fresh basil leaf on top.
Roll up the salami slice and secure it with a toothpick or skewer.
Repeat for as many salami rolls as you'd like to make.
Serve as an appetizer or snack.

ingredients: A small piece of ginger, grated
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, green chilies, grated ginger, and salt. Mix well.
In a separate pan, heat oil for deep frying.
In a small pan, heat a little oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, and chopped curry leaves. Sauté until the mustard seeds splutter.
Add this tempering to the potato mixture and mix well.
Make small balls from the potato mixture and keep aside.
Prepare a batter by mixing gram flour with water and a pinch of salt. The batter should be thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.
Dip the potato balls in the gram flour batter and deep fry in hot oil until they turn golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.
In a bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
Heat butter in a pan over medium heat.
Add onions and bell peppers and sauté until they are soft.
Add mushrooms and cook until they are tender and any liquid has evaporated.
Pour the beaten eggs over the cooked vegetables.
Sprinkle grated cheese (if using) evenly over the eggs.
Cover the pan and cook until the eggs are set and the cheese is melted.
Fold the omelette in half and serve hot.

ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (peas, carrots, beans), finely chopped
methods: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Sauté until they splutter.
Add chopped onions and curry leaves. Sauté until the onions turn translucent.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes until they are cooked.
Add cubed idlis and mix gently until they are coated with the masala.
Cover and cook for a few more minutes until the idlis are heated through.
Serve hot as a snack or breakfast item.
In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, bread crumbs, grated paneer, garam masala, red chili powder, cumin powder, chaat masala, and salt.
Mix well to form a smooth mixture.
Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into kebabs.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the kebabs until they are golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with chutney or yogurt.
In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, semolina, turmeric powder, ginger-green chili paste, lemon juice, sugar, and salt.
Add water and make a smooth batter. Let it rest for 15-20 minutes.
Grease a steaming plate or dhokla tray.
Add fruit salt (eno) to the batter and mix well. The batter will become frothy.
Pour the batter into the greased plate and steam for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
For tempering, heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Sauté until the mustard seeds splutter.
Pour the tempering over the steamed dhokla.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and grated coconut.
Cut into squares and serve.
In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, red chili powder, garam masala, baking soda, and salt.
Add water gradually and make a thick batter.
Dip the blanched cauliflower florets into the batter and deep fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.
In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, red chili powder, asafoetida, ajwain, and salt.
Add water gradually and knead into a smooth, stiff dough.
Heat oil for frying.
Use a sev maker or chakli maker with a fine hole plate. Fill it with the dough.
Press the dough directly into hot oil in a circular motion.
Fry until the sev turns golden brown and crispy.
Remove and drain on paper towels.
Once cool, store in an airtight container.
In a pan, combine sugar and water. Cook over medium heat until the sugar dissolves and the syrup thickens slightly.
Add freshly grated coconut and cardamom powder to the syrup. Mix well.
Cook, stirring continuously, until the mixture thickens and leaves the sides of the pan.
Add saffron strands (if using) for color and flavor. Mix well.
Grease a plate or tray with ghee and transfer the coconut mixture to it. Press it evenly.
Allow it to cool and set for a few hours.
Cut into desired shapes and serve.

ingredients: A handful of fresh coriander leaves, chopped
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, chopped onions, green chilies, fresh coriander leaves, cumin seeds, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt.
Mix well to form a smooth mixture.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Take small portions of the potato mixture and shape them into round fritters or balls.
Deep fry in hot oil until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.
In a mixing bowl, combine rice flour, grated coconut, green chilies, curry leaves, cumin seeds, and salt.
Add water gradually and mix to make a smooth batter. The batter should be thin, similar to dosa batter.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle and grease it with a little oil.
Pour a ladleful of the batter onto the pan and spread it in a circular motion to make thin pancakes.
Cook until both sides are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.

ingredients: 1/2 cup finely chopped vegetables (carrots, peas, beans)
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine grated paneer, boiled and mashed potatoes, bread crumbs, finely chopped vegetables, garam masala, red chili powder, cumin powder, and salt.
Mix well to form a smooth mixture.
Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into cutlets.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the cutlets until they are golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with chutney or ketchup.
In a mixing bowl, combine chopped sausages, grated cheddar cheese, bread crumbs, milk, finely chopped green chilies, salt, and pepper.
Mix well to form a dough-like mixture.
Take small portions of the mixture and shape them into balls.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the balls until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with ketchup or mustard sauce.
In a mixing bowl, combine rice flour, grated coconut, and salt.
Add water gradually and mix to make a thin batter. The batter should be watery.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle and grease it lightly with oil.
Pour a ladleful of the batter onto the pan and spread it thinly by rotating the pan.
Cover and cook for a minute or until the dosa is done.
Fold the dosa and serve hot with chutney or curry.
In a mixing bowl, combine rava, rice flour, all-purpose flour, chopped green chilies, chopped curry leaves, cumin seeds, black peppercorns, and salt.
Add water gradually and mix to make a thin, runny batter. The batter should be watery.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle and grease it lightly with oil.
Pour a ladleful of the batter onto the pan in a circular motion to make a thin dosa.
Drizzle a little oil around the edges and cook until it turns golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sambar.
Wash and soak dosa rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds together for 5-6 hours or overnight.
Grind the soaked mixture into a smooth batter.
Add poha, curd, and salt to the batter. Mix well and let it ferment for 8-10 hours or until it doubles in volume.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle and grease it lightly with oil.
Pour a ladleful of the batter onto the pan to make thick, small dosas (set dosas).
Cover and cook until the dosas are cooked through.
Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

ingredients: 1/4 cup chopped mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans)
methods: Heat ghee in a pan and add mustard seeds, urad dal, cumin seeds, slit green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until the mustard seeds splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add chopped mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes until they are slightly tender.
Add semolina (sooji) and roast on low heat until it turns golden brown and aromatic.
Add roasted peanuts and salt. Mix well.
Add water gradually and stir continuously to avoid lumps. Cook until the upma is thick and well-cooked.
Serve hot as a breakfast dish.
In a mixing bowl, combine grated cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, cream cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Mix well until all the ingredients are well combined and the spread is smooth.
Refrigerate for a while before using to allow the flavors to meld.
Use as a sandwich spread or dip.
For Puris:
In a mixing bowl, combine semolina, baking soda, and a little salt.
Add water gradually and knead into a stiff dough. Let it rest for 15-20 minutes.
Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into balls.
Roll out each ball into a small, thin disc.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying and fry the discs until they puff up and turn golden brown. Drain and keep aside.
For Pani (Spiced Water):
Blend mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chilies, cumin seeds, black salt, chaat masala, asafoetida, and salt with a little water to make a smooth paste.
Add more water to the paste to make it thin and adjust the seasoning to taste.
For Filling:
Mix cooked chickpeas, mashed potatoes, and finely chopped onions.
To Assemble:
Make a small hole in each puri, creating a cavity for the filling.
Stuff the puris with the chickpea-potato mixture.
Dip the stuffed puris in the prepared spiced water (pani) and serve immediately.
Drizzle tamarind chutney on top and garnish with nylon sev.
In a bowl, beat the eggs and milk together until well combined.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add the butter.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook, stirring gently, until the eggs are softly set.
Remove from heat and serve hot.

ingredients: Lettuce leaves and tomato slices for garnish
methods: In a bowl, mix together the canned tuna, mayonnaise, and pickle relish.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Spread the tuna mixture on one slice of bread.
Top with lettuce leaves and tomato slices.
Cover with the second slice of bread to make a sandwich.
Cut in half and serve.
Wash and soak rice, urad dal, and methi seeds together for 4-5 hours.
Grind the soaked mixture into a smooth batter.
Add salt and mix well. Let it ferment for 6-8 hours or overnight.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle and grease it lightly with oil.
Pour a ladleful of the batter onto the pan and spread it to make a thin dosa.
Drizzle a little oil around the edges and cook until it turns golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sambar.
Preheat your oven to 200°C (400°F).
In a bowl, mix together the chopped prawns, onions, bell peppers, mayonnaise, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Roll out the thawed puff pastry sheet and cut it into small squares.
Place a spoonful of the prawn mixture in the center of each square.
Fold the pastry over to form a triangle and seal the edges with a fork.
Brush the tops of the puffs with beaten egg for a golden finish.
Place the puffs on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes or until they are puffed up and golden brown.
Serve hot.

ingredients: A handful of fresh coriander leaves, chopped
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine chopped shrimp, mashed potatoes, finely chopped onions, green chilies, fresh coriander leaves, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Mix well to form a smooth mixture.
Take small portions of the mixture and shape them into cutlets.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the cutlets until they are golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.

ingredients: A pinch of red chili powder
methods: For Potato Filling:
In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until the mustard seeds splutter.
Add turmeric powder and red chili powder. Mix well.
Add boiled and mashed potatoes and salt. Cook for a few minutes until well combined. Let it cool.
Shape the potato mixture into small balls and keep aside.
For Batter:
In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, baking soda, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Add water gradually and mix to make a thick batter.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Dip the potato balls into the batter and deep fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or pav (bread rolls).
Spread mayonnaise on one side of each bread slice.
Layer ham slices, lettuce leaves, finely chopped celery, and finely chopped onions on two of the bread slices.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover with the remaining bread slices to make sandwiches.
Cut in half and serve.

ingredients: 4 slices of bacon, cooked and crispy
methods: Spread mayonnaise on one side of each bread slice.
Layer crispy bacon slices, cheddar cheese slices, lettuce leaves, and tomato slices on two of the bread slices.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cover with the remaining bread slices to make sandwiches.
Cut in half and serve.
Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
In a bowl, mix together grated cheddar cheese, grated Parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish and spread the cheesy mixture over the top.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
Serve hot.
In a pan, heat butter and sauté finely chopped onions and minced garlic until they are translucent.
Add chicken liver and cook until they are cooked through and no longer pink inside.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer the mixture to a food processor and blend until smooth.
Serve as a spread for bread or crackers.
In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, and curry leaves. Sauté until the mustard seeds splutter.
Add chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add turmeric powder and red chili powder. Mix well.
Add mixed sprouts and sprouted moth beans. Cook for a few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the sprouts are tender.
Season with salt and lemon juice. Mix well.
To serve, place the cooked sprouts mixture in a bowl.
Top with chopped onions, chopped tomatoes, farsan, sev, tamarind chutney, and cilantro.
Serve hot as a delicious snack.
In a bowl, mix together finely chopped cooked mutton, mayonnaise, and mustard sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Spread the mutton mixture on biscuits and serve as a snack or appetizer.
In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, grated cheddar cheese, finely chopped onions, bread crumbs, chopped cilantro, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Mix well to form a dough-like mixture.
Take small portions of the mixture and shape them into flat, round patties (crispies).
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the crispies until they are golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot as a snack or side dish.
In a mixing bowl, combine besan, red chili powder, turmeric powder, asafoetida, curry leaves, and salt.
Add water gradually and mix to make a thick batter.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Dip the potato slices in the besan batter and deep fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney.

ingredients: Oil or ghee for cooking dosa
methods: For Dosa Batter:
Wash and soak dosa rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds together for 6-8 hours.
Grind the soaked mixture into a smooth batter. Add salt and mix well. Let it ferment for 6-8 hours or overnight.
For Masala Filling:
In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Sauté until the mustard seeds splutter.
Add finely chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add turmeric powder and mashed potatoes. Cook for a few minutes until well combined. Season with salt.
To Make Dosa:
Heat a dosa griddle and grease it lightly with oil or ghee.
Pour a ladleful of dosa batter onto the griddle and spread it in a circular motion to make a thin dosa.
Place a spoonful of the masala filling on one half of the dosa and fold it over to make a semi-circle.
Cook until the dosa is crispy and golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.
In a bowl, marinate boneless chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt.
Let it marinate for at least 2 hours.
Thread the marinated chicken pieces onto skewers and grill or roast until they are cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve hot as a snack or appetizer.
In a mixing bowl, combine chickpea flour, red chili powder, turmeric powder, asafoetida, and salt.
Add water gradually and mix to make a thick batter.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Pour the batter into the hot oil through a perforated spoon to create small droplets (ganthai).
Fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot as a snack.

ingredients: 1/2 cup yellow moong dal (split yellow lentils), soaked
methods: For Kachori Dough:
In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, oil or ghee, and salt.
Add water gradually and knead into a firm dough. Cover and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.
For Kachori Filling:
Grind soaked yellow moong dal into a coarse paste without adding water.
In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds, fennel seeds, and asafoetida. Sauté for a few seconds.
Add the ground moong dal paste, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until the mixture thickens and the moisture evaporates.
To Make Kachori:
Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into balls.
Flatten each ball and place a spoonful of the moong dal filling in the center.
Seal the edges and shape them into round kachoris.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Fry the kachoris until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or aloo sabzi (potato curry).
In a bowl, mix together cooked and peeled shrimp, mayonnaise, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread butter on both sides of the bread slices.
Toast the bread slices until they are golden brown.
Spread the shrimp mixture on the toasted bread slices.
Serve hot as an open-faced sandwich.
In a bowl, beat the eggs until well mixed.
In a pan, heat butter and add finely chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add beaten eggs, salt, and pepper to the pan. Cook, stirring gently, until the eggs are softly set.
Spread the scrambled eggs and onion mixture on two slices of bread.
Cover with the remaining bread slices to make sandwiches.
Cut in half and serve.
Soak chana dal in water for 2-3 hours.
Drain the dal and grind it into a coarse paste without adding water.
In a mixing bowl, combine the ground dal, finely chopped green chilies, finely chopped onion, rice flour, cumin seeds, asafoetida, chopped curry leaves, and salt.
Mix well and shape the mixture into small patties (vadai).
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Fry the vadai until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sambar.
In a bowl, beat the eggs until well mixed.
Add chopped onions, chopped tomatoes, finely chopped green chilies, chopped cilantro, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Pour the mixture into greased idli molds.
Steam for 10-15 minutes or until the omelette is set.
Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans), finely chopped
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine finely chopped mixed vegetables, grated paneer, besan, cumin powder, garam masala, red chili powder, chaat masala, and salt.
Mix well and shape the mixture onto wooden skewers to form seekh kebabs.
Grill or bake the seekh kebabs until they are cooked through and have grill marks.
Serve hot with chutney or raita.

ingredients: 250 grams boneless fish fillets, boiled and flaked
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine flaked fish fillets, mashed potatoes, chopped onions, chopped cilantro, finely chopped green chilies, turmeric powder, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Mix well and shape the mixture into flat patties (cutlets).
Coat each cutlet with bread crumbs.
Heat oil in a pan for shallow frying.
Fry the cutlets until they are golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney.
Wash and soak urad dal, rice, and fenugreek seeds together for 4-6 hours.
Grind the soaked mixture into a smooth batter. Add salt and mix well.
Heat a dosa griddle and grease it lightly with oil.
Pour a ladleful of dosa batter onto the griddle and spread it in a circular motion to make a thin dosa.
Cook until the dosa is crispy and golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with chutney or sambar.
Soak urad dal in water for 2-3 hours.
Drain the dal and grind it into a smooth batter without adding too much water.
In a mixing bowl, combine the urad dal batter, finely chopped green chilies, finely chopped onion, chopped cilantro, asafoetida, and salt.
Mix well.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Take small portions of the batter and shape them into round vadas.
Fry the vadas until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sambar.
In a mixing bowl, combine boiled and mashed potatoes, besan, red chili powder, asafoetida, chopped curry leaves, and salt.
Mix well to form a dough-like mixture.
Take small portions of the mixture and shape them into round bondas.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Fry the bondas until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

ingredients: A few fresh mint leaves, chopped
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine boiled and mashed potatoes, cumin powder, red chili powder, chaat masala, chopped mint leaves, and salt.
Mix well and shape the mixture into flat tikkis.
Heat oil in a pan for shallow frying.
Fry the tikkis until they are golden brown on both sides.
Place the fried tikkis on a serving plate.
Top each tikki with a spoonful of thick yogurt.
Garnish with additional chaat masala and chopped mint leaves.
Serve immediately.

ingredients: Green chutney and tamarind chutney for spreading
A few slices of onion and tomato for garnish
methods: For Batata Vada:
In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, and chopped curry leaves. Sauté until the mustard seeds splutter.
Add finely chopped green chilies and sauté for a minute.
Add turmeric powder and mashed potatoes. Cook for a few minutes.
Season with salt and add chopped cilantro. Mix well.
Shape the mixture into round patties (vada) and deep fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
For Pav (Bread Rolls):
Slice the pav horizontally, keeping one end intact.
Spread green chutney on one side and tamarind chutney on the other side of the pav.
Place a vada inside the pav and garnish with slices of onion and tomato.
Serve hot.
Wash sabudana thoroughly and soak in water for 4-5 hours or until they become soft and fluffy.
Drain excess water from sabudana and keep them covered for 4-5 hours.
In a pan, heat ghee and add cumin seeds and curry leaves. Sauté until cumin seeds crackle.
Add finely chopped green chilies and sauté for a minute.
Add soaked sabudana, coarsely crushed roasted peanuts, sugar, and salt. Mix well.
Cover and cook on low heat for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Once the sabudana pearls turn translucent and become non-sticky, remove from heat.
Add lemon juice and mix well.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans), finely chopped
methods: In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Sauté until they splutter.
Add finely chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add mixed vegetables and cook until they are tender.
Add grated paneer, finely chopped bell peppers, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.
Remove from heat and let the mixture cool.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Take a phyllo pastry sheet and cut it into strips. Brush each strip with butter.
Place a spoonful of the vegetable mixture at one end of each strip and fold it into a triangle.
Brush the top with butter and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the triangles are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot.
Slit the frankfurter sausages lengthwise, but don't cut them in half.
Stuff each sausage with mashed potato and season with salt and pepper.
Roll the stuffed sausages in breadcrumbs to coat them evenly.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the sausages until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with ketchup or mustard.
In a bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a pan and pour the beaten eggs to make thin omelets.
Place the omelets on parathas or tortillas.
Top with thinly sliced onions, bell peppers, and lettuce leaves.
Drizzle mayonnaise and ketchup over the toppings.
Roll up the parathas or tortillas tightly and serve.
In a bowl, beat the eggs until well mixed.
Heat a non-stick pan and add butter. Let it melt and coat the pan.
Pour the beaten eggs into the pan and let them cook over low heat.
Gently push the cooked eggs from the edges toward the center, allowing the uncooked eggs to flow to the edges.
Season with salt and pepper.
Once the omelette is set but still slightly runny on top, fold it in half.
Garnish with chopped herbs if desired.
Slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot.
Place a slice of cheese between two slices of bread to make a sandwich.
Spread butter on the outside of each sandwich.
Heat a pan and grill the sandwiches until they are golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with ketchup.

ingredients: 1/2 cup grated cheese (cheddar, parmesan, or your choice)
methods: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Roll out the puff pastry sheet and sprinkle grated cheese, paprika, salt, and pepper evenly on it.
Fold the pastry sheet in half to encase the cheese.
Cut the pastry into thin strips to make straws.
Place the straws on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes or until they are puffed and golden brown.
Serve as a snack or appetizer.
In a bowl, mix together oil, minced garlic, paprika, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Add prawns to the mixture and marinate for 15-20 minutes.
Thread the marinated prawns onto wooden skewers.
Grill or roast the prawn sticks until they are cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve hot as a snack or appetizer.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, mix together crumbled mawa, powdered sugar, and chopped nuts.
Cut the naan bread into halves to make two pieces.
Spread the mawa mixture on one half of each naan bread and cover with the other half.
Brush the naan with ghee and place them on a baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until they are heated through and slightly crispy.
Garnish with saffron strands if desired.
Serve hot as a sweet treat.
For Puris:
In a bowl, mix wheat flour and salt. Gradually add water and knead into a firm dough.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll them into puris.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the puris until they are puffed and golden brown.
For Filling:
In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, chopped eggs, finely chopped onions, finely chopped green chilies, cumin powder, chaat masala, and salt.
Mix well to make the filling.
To Serve:
Make a hole in the center of each puri and fill it with the egg and potato mixture.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with tamarind chutney.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a pan, heat oil and sauté finely chopped onions and green chilies until onions turn translucent.
Add finely chopped bell peppers and cook for a few minutes.
Add turmeric powder, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Remove from heat and let the mixture cool.
Lay out each fish fillet and spread a layer of mashed potatoes on top.
Add a spoonful of the vegetable mixture on top of the potatoes.
Roll up the fish fillets and secure with toothpicks.
Brush with oil and coat with breadcrumbs.
Place the fish rolls on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes or until they are cooked through and golden brown.
Serve hot as an appetizer or snack.

ingredients: A handful of cilantro (coriander leaves), chopped
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, grated cheese, thinly sliced onions, finely chopped green chilies, chopped cilantro, cumin seeds, baking soda, and salt.
Add water gradually to make a thick batter.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Drop spoonfuls of the batter into hot oil and fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve hot with chutney or ketchup.

ingredients: A handful of cilantro (coriander leaves), chopped
methods: Cut each papad into two long strips.
In a bowl, mix grated cheese, finely chopped onions, finely chopped green chilies, chopped cilantro, and salt.
Place a spoonful of the cheese mixture on each papad strip and roll them up.
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the papad rolls until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot as a crunchy snack.
In a mixing bowl, combine ground chicken, breadcrumbs, finely chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
Mix well to form a dough-like mixture.
Take small portions of the mixture and shape them into balls.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Fry the chicken balls until they are golden brown and cooked through.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve hot with a dipping sauce of your choice.

ingredients: Lettuce leaves, tomato slices, and mayonnaise for garnish
methods: In a mixing bowl, combine ground chicken, breadcrumbs, finely chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
Mix well to form a burger patty mixture.
Shape the mixture into burger patties.
Heat a grill or pan and cook the chicken patties until they are cooked through and have grill marks on both sides.
Slice the burger buns and toast them on the grill or in a toaster.
Assemble the burgers with lettuce leaves, tomato slices, chicken patties, and mayonnaise.
Serve hot as delicious chicken burgers.
For Samosa Dough:
In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, ghee, and salt.
Knead the mixture into a firm dough, adding water as needed.
Cover and let the dough rest for 30 minutes.
For Kheema Filling:
In a pan, heat oil and add finely chopped onions, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add minced chicken or mutton and cook until it's browned.
Add red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook until the filling is cooked through.
Remove from heat and let the filling cool.
To Assemble Samosas:
Divide the dough into small balls and roll each ball into a thin oval shape.
Cut each oval in half to make two semi-circles.
Fold each semi-circle into a cone shape, sealing the edges with water.
Fill each cone with the kheema filling and seal the open edge to form a triangular samosa.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying and fry the samosas until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.
In a pan, heat oil and add finely chopped onions, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add minced mutton and cook until it's browned.
Add red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook until the mutton is cooked through.
Remove from heat and let the mixture cool.
Mix the mashed potatoes with the mutton mixture to form a dough-like mixture.
Shape the mixture into potato chops.
Coat the chops with breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying and fry the potato chops until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot as a snack or appetizer.

ingredients: 1/4 cup green peas, boiled and mashed
methods: For Outer Covering:
In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, ghee, and salt.
Knead the mixture into a firm dough, adding water as needed.
Cover and let the dough rest for 30 minutes.
For Filling:
In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Sauté until they splutter.
Add finely chopped green chilies and sauté for a minute.
Add mashed potatoes, mashed green peas, mashed carrots, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.
Remove from heat and let the filling cool.
To Assemble Pan Rolls:
Divide the dough into small balls and roll each ball into a thin circle.
Place a spoonful of the filling in the center of each circle and fold it into a roll, sealing the edges.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying and fry the pan rolls until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.
In a pan, heat butter and add cumin seeds. Sauté until they splutter.
Add finely chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add mashed potatoes, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.
Remove from heat and let the mixture cool.
Spread a generous amount of the potato mixture on each slice of bread.
Heat a griddle or pan and toast the potato-topped bread slices until they are golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot as potato toast.
Heat oil in a pan and add raw peanuts.
Roast the peanuts on low heat until they are crispy and golden brown.
Sprinkle red chili powder, chaat masala, and salt over the roasted peanuts. Mix well.
Remove from heat and let them cool completely.
Serve as a crunchy snack.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Using a vegetable peeler, peel thin strips of potato.
Wrap each strip of potato with a slice of bacon and secure with a toothpick.
Place the bacon-wrapped potato strips on a baking sheet and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the bacon is crispy and the potatoes are cooked through.
Serve hot as a delightful snack.

ingredients: 1/4 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans), finely chopped
methods: In a microwave-safe bowl, heat oil for 1-2 minutes in the microwave.
Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, green chilies, and curry leaves. Microwave for 1-2 minutes or until the spices splutter.
Add finely chopped onions and mixed vegetables. Microwave for 2-3 minutes or until they are slightly cooked.
Add semolina and roast in the microwave for 3-4 minutes or until it turns golden brown and aromatic.
Stir in roasted peanuts and salt. Add enough water to cover the mixture and mix well.
Microwave for 2-3 minutes, stirring in between, until the upma is cooked and water is absorbed.
Let it rest for a minute, fluff with a fork, and serve hot.
In a microwave-safe bowl, melt butter for 1-2 minutes in the microwave.
Add chopped bacon and microwave for 2-3 minutes or until it's crispy.
Add finely chopped onions and minced garlic. Microwave for 2-3 minutes or until they are translucent.
Stir in sliced mushrooms and microwave for 3-4 minutes or until they are cooked and tender.
Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with chopped parsley.
Serve hot as a savory side dish.

ingredients: 2-3 slices of bacon, cooked and crumbled
methods: In a microwave-safe bowl, crack the eggs and beat them lightly.
Stir in grated cheese, finely chopped bell peppers, and finely chopped tomatoes.
Microwave for 2-3 minutes, stirring in between, or until the eggs are cooked and the mixture is set.
Top with crumbled bacon, salt, pepper, and chopped chives.
Serve hot as a delicious breakfast.
Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Dip each fish fillet in melted butter and coat with the breadcrumb mixture.
Place the coated fish fillets on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until the fish is cooked through and the coating is crispy and golden brown.
Serve hot as an oven-fried fish dish.

ingredients: Cucumber slices, tomato slices, and lettuce leaves for garnish
methods: Lay out 4 slices of bread and spread butter, mayonnaise, and ketchup or mustard on each slice.
Layer each slice with a slice of cheese and a slice of ham or turkey (if using).
Place a second slice of bread on top and press down gently.
Using a flower-shaped cookie cutter, cut out flower-shaped sandwiches.
Garnish each flower sandwich with cucumber slices, tomato slices, and lettuce leaves.
Serve as adorable flower-shaped sandwiches.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Roll out the puff pastry sheet and spread mustard over it.
Place sausages along the center of the puff pastry sheet.
Fold the puff pastry over the sausages and seal the edges.
Brush the top with egg wash and sprinkle sesame seeds over it.
Cut slits on top for ventilation.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown and puffed up.
Slice and serve hot as a sausage twist.
In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, grated cheese, cornstarch, red chili powder, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Mix well to form a dough-like mixture.
Shape the mixture into small balls.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Fry the potato cheese balls until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve hot as potato cheese balls.
In a mixing bowl, combine shredded chicken, grated cheese, finely chopped onions, mayonnaise, ketchup, salt, and pepper.
Mix well to make a chicken and cheese mixture.
Spread the mixture on bread slices to make sandwiches.
Cut into desired shapes and serve as chicken and cheese savories.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut the tops off the tomatoes and scoop out the pulp to create tomato cups.
In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs, grated Parmesan cheese, minced garlic, chopped basil, salt, and pepper.
Stuff each tomato with the breadcrumb mixture.
Drizzle olive oil over the stuffed tomatoes.
Place the stuffed tomatoes in a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the tomatoes are tender and the topping is golden brown.
Serve hot as baked tomatoes.
In a mixing bowl, combine grated cheese, finely chopped onions, finely chopped green chilies, chopped fresh coriander leaves, salt, and pepper.
Mix well to make a cheese mixture.
Spread the mixture on bread slices.
Cut into squares or desired shapes and serve as cheese squares.
In a mixing bowl, combine boiled and mashed potatoes, boiled green peas, breadcrumbs, finely chopped green chilies, cumin seeds, chaat masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Mix well to form a smooth mixture.
Divide the mixture into small portions and shape them into tikkis or patties.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the tikkis until they are golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Serve hot as chatpati tikki.
In a bowl, combine lemon juice, minced garlic, olive oil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Marinate the fish fillets in this mixture for 30 minutes.
Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the marinated fish fillets for 4-5 minutes on each side or until they are cooked through and have grill marks.
Garnish with lemon wedges and serve hot as grilled lemon fish.
In a pan, heat a little oil and sauté the finely chopped mushrooms until they release their moisture and become dry.
In a mixing bowl, combine sautéed mushrooms, boiled and mashed potatoes, grated paneer, finely chopped green chilies, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt.
Mix well to form a smooth mixture.
Divide the mixture into small portions and shape them into kababs or patties.
Coat the kababs with breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the kababs until they are golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Serve hot as mushroom shammi kababs.
In a mixing bowl, combine papadi, boiled and chopped potatoes, boiled chickpeas, chopped onions, chopped tomatoes, and chopped fresh coriander leaves.
Add sweet tamarind chutney, red chili powder, chaat masala, and cumin powder. Mix well.
Garnish with yogurt and sev.
Serve immediately as Punjabi papadi chaat.
In a mixing bowl, combine chopped spinach leaves, gram flour, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin seeds, baking soda, and salt.
Add enough water to make a thick batter.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Drop spoonfuls of the spinach batter into the hot oil and fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve hot as spinach pakodas.
Grind soaked urad dal into a smooth paste using a little water.
Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Drop spoonfuls of the urad dal batter into the hot oil and fry until they are golden brown and cooked through.
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Dip the fried bhallas in warm water for a few minutes to soften them.
Squeeze out excess water and arrange the bhallas in a serving dish.
Whisk yogurt with a little salt and spread it over the bhallas.
Drizzle sweet tamarind chutney and green chutney over the yogurt.
Sprinkle cumin powder and red chili powder on top.
Serve chilled as stuffed dahi bhallas.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (bell peppers, onions, tomatoes), cubed
methods: In a pan, heat a little oil and sauté mixed vegetables until they are slightly cooked.
Add cubed paneer and sauté for a few minutes until paneer turns golden brown.
In a bowl, whisk yogurt with cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt.
Pour the yogurt mixture over the sautéed vegetables and paneer.
Stir well and cook for a few more minutes until everything is well coated and heated through.
Serve hot as vegetable & paneer delight.
Wash and rinse all the dals together.
Pressure cook the dals with turmeric powder and enough water until they are soft and mushy.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, and chopped green chili. Sauté for a minute.
Add asafoetida and sauté briefly.
Pour this tempering over the cooked dal. Add salt and simmer for a few minutes.
Serve Panchmel Daliche Varan hot with rice or roti.
In a bowl, whisk together yogurt, besan, turmeric powder, and water to make a smooth mixture.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and asafoetida. Sauté until they splutter.
Add curry leaves, green chilies, and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute.
Pour the yogurt mixture into the pan and stir continuously on medium heat.
Let it simmer until the kadhi thickens and comes to a boil. Add salt and simmer for a few more minutes.
Serve Maharashtrian Kadhi hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: 1/4 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until they are soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden brown.
Add grated ginger, chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and oil separates.
Add the cooked dal and salt. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed, to reach the desired consistency.
Serve Dhabey Di Dal hot with rice or naan.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden brown.
Add grated ginger, chopped tomato, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the soaked and drained lobia. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.
Add enough water to cover the lobia, and simmer until they are cooked and the gravy thickens.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Lobia hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until they are soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, chopped green chilies, and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomato, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked dal and salt. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed, to reach the desired consistency.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Wateli Dal hot with rice or roti.

ingredients: 1 cup black gram dal (urad dal), soaked
1/4 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder and salt until they are soft.
Heat butter in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, chopped green chilies, and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden brown.
Add chopped tomato, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked dal and kidney beans. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Stir in cream and simmer for a few more minutes.
Serve Dal Maharani hot with naan or rice.

ingredients: 1/4 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until they are soft.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and asafoetida. Sauté until they splutter.
Add dried red chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked dal and salt. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Rajasthani Dal hot with roti or rice.

ingredients: 1/2 cup whole urad dal (black gram), soaked
1/4 cup black gram dal (urad dal), split and soaked
1/4 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder and salt until they are soft.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and asafoetida. Sauté until they splutter.
Add dried red chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked dal and kidney beans. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Punj Rattani Dal hot with naan or rice.

ingredients: 1/2 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until they are soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the chopped okra and cluster beans. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add the cooked dal and simmer for a few more minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Bheendi Gavar Dal hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse the chana dal.
Pressure cook the chana dal with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the cooked chana dal and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Gram Dal hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse the chana dal. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the cooked chana dal and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Katachi Aamti hot with rice or roti.
Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric powder until it is soft and mushy.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, asafoetida, dried red chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, and curry leaves. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add cooked toor dal, black pepper powder, and salt. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Tomato Rasam hot as a soup or with rice.
In a bowl, whisk together yogurt, besan, turmeric powder, and water to make a smooth mixture.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and asafoetida. Sauté for a minute.
Add curry leaves, green chilies, and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute.
Pour the yogurt mixture into the pan and stir continuously on medium heat.
Let it simmer until the kadhi thickens and comes to a boil. Add salt and simmer for a few more minutes.
Serve Gujarati Kadhi hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: 1 cup chana dal (Bengal gram dal), soaked
methods: Wash and rinse the chana dal. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the cooked chana dal and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Cholar Dal/Bengal Gram Dal hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse the toor dal. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the cooked toor dal and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Yellow Dal Fry hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse the masoor dal.
Pressure cook the masoor dal with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the chopped spinach and cook until it wilts.
Add the cooked masoor dal and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Palak Masoor Dal hot with rice or roti.
Wash and rinse the masoor dal. Pressure cook with turmeric powder until it is soft.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Add cream, red chili powder, and salt. Simmer for a few minutes.
Add the cooked masoor dal and simmer for a few more minutes.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Dal Pakhtooni hot with naan or rice.

ingredients: 1/2 cup black gram dal (urad dal), soaked
1/4 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse all the dals together. Pressure cook with turmeric powder and salt until they are soft.
Heat butter in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked dal and kidney beans. Simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Stir in cream and simmer for a few more minutes.
Serve Dal Makhani hot with naan or rice.
Pressure cook the soaked kidney beans until they are soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the cooked kidney beans and simmer for a few minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Rajmah Rasmisa hot with rice or roti.

ingredients: 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, drumsticks, etc.), chopped
methods: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric powder until it is soft and mushy.
In a separate pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, dried red chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes.
Add tamarind paste, sambhar powder, and salt. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Add the cooked toor dal and simmer for a few more minutes, adding water if needed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Sambhar hot with rice or idli.
Wash and rinse the rice and sprouted moong together.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add rice and sprouted moong, turmeric powder, and salt. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add garam masala and water. Cook until the khichdi is soft and well-cooked.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Sprouted Moong Khichdi hot.
Cook the rice and set it aside to cool.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, asafoetida, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until the dals turn golden brown.
Add tamarind paste and puliyodharai powder. Sauté for a few minutes.
Mix the tamarind mixture with the cooked rice, add salt, and mix well.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Puliyodharai.
Cook the rice and set it aside to cool.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add turmeric powder and salt. Sauté for a few more minutes.
Mix the tempering with the cooked rice and toss well.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Fodnicha Bhaat.
Wash and rinse the rice.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add carrots and green peas, turmeric powder, and salt. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add the washed rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Carrot & Pea Pulao.
Wash and rinse the rice.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and sauté until they turn soft.
Add soya granules, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Sauté for a few minutes.
Add the washed rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Tomato Soya Pulao.

ingredients: 1/2 cup split green gram dal (moong dal)
methods: Wash and rinse the rice and split green gram dal together.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add onion rings and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Sauté for a few more minutes.
Add the washed rice and dal mixture and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Moong Ring Pulao.
Wash and rinse the rice.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add fresh methi leaves and corn kernels. Sauté until the methi leaves wilt.
Add turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Sauté for a few more minutes.
Add the washed rice and sauté for another few minutes.
Add water, cover, and cook until the rice is done and the water is absorbed.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve Methi Corn Pulao.
Cook the rice and set it aside to cool.

For Gravy:

In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, drumsticks, etc.), diced
methods: In a pan, heat coconut oil and add cumin seeds and green chilies.

ingredients: 1 cup colocasia leaves (arbi ke patte), chopped

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, etc.), boiled

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., potatoes, yam, brinjal, peas), diced

For Gatte:
In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, cumin seeds, red chili powder, asafoetida, salt, yogurt, and oil.
Knead the mixture into a stiff dough. Add water as needed.
Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into cylindrical dumplings (gatte).
Boil the gatte in water until they float to the surface. Drain and set aside.
For Gravy:
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the boiled gatte to the gravy and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Gatte Ki Sabzi.
In a bowl, mix turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
Coat the eggplant slices with the spice mixture.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the eggplant slices until they are cooked and golden brown on both sides.
Serve Begun Bhaja hot.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (potatoes, pumpkin, eggplant, beans, etc.), diced
methods: In a pan, heat mustard oil until it smokes. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.

Add diced mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes.
Stir in grated coconut, chopped green chilies, and salt. Mix well.

ingredients: 500 grams arbi (taro root), boiled and peeled
methods: Heat ghee in a pan, add chopped onions, and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add boiled and peeled arbi (taro root) and cook for a few minutes.
Whisk together yogurt and cream and add it to the pan. Simmer until the arbi is coated with the creamy mixture.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Mughlai Arbi.
For Koftas:
In a bowl, combine mashed potatoes, grated paneer, corn flour, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Shape the mixture into small round koftas and deep fry them in hot oil until they are golden brown. Drain and set aside.
For Curry:
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add water to make the gravy and simmer for a few minutes.
Add the fried koftas to the curry and simmer for a few more minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Kandhari Kofta Curry.

ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon saffron strands soaked in warm milk
methods: In a bowl, mix yogurt, saffron strands soaked in warm milk, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.

In a pan, heat ghee and sauté the cauliflower until it is cooked and golden brown.

ingredients: 500 grams arbi (taro root), boiled and peeled
methods: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.

Stuff the okra with the gram flour mixture.

Clean and slice the lotus stem (nadur) and blanch it in boiling water until it is tender. Drain and set aside.

Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve Mushroom & Cheese Bake.

patterns: Creamed Diced Carrots with Green Pepper
