In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, sambhar masala, asafoetida, and salt. Mix well.
Add diced potatoes and cook until they are tender.
Add the cooked toor dal (split pigeon peas) and simmer for a few more minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Sambhar Potatoes.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add diced eggplant (aubergine) and cook until they are tender.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cooked chickpeas and chopped tomatoes. Cook until the tomatoes become soft.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Chickpea & Aubergine Casserole.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add diced potatoes and cook until they are tender.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Potato Flair.
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
In another bowl, beat the eggs and milk together.
Add the egg and milk mixture to the dry ingredients and mix well to form a smooth batter.
In a baking dish, melt the butter and spread it evenly.
Add the thinly sliced onions and grated cheese over the butter.
Pour the batter over the onions and cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the pie is set.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve Onion & Cheese Pie.

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, etc.), diced
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add diced mixed vegetables and cook until they are tender.
Add tamarind pulp and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Tangy Veggies.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add cubed cheese and cook for a few minutes.
Stir in cashew nut paste and cream. Simmer for a few more minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Shahi Cheese.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan.
Take the grated potatoes in a bowl, add chopped onions, green chilies, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Shape the mixture into small nests and deep fry until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove from the oil and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Bird's Nest.
In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped cabbage and sauté until they are tender.
Stir in turmeric powder, chopped green chilies, and salt. Mix well.
Add cooked chana dal (split chickpeas) and cook for a few more minutes.
Remove from heat and let it cool.
Once cooled, add yogurt and mix well.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Cabbage Dal Koshimbir.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.

ingredients: Chopped fresh curry leaves for garnish
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped green chilies and grated papaya. Sauté until papaya is cooked and tender.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add grated coconut and cook for a few more minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh curry leaves and serve Papaya Thoran.

ingredients: Chopped fresh curry leaves for garnish
methods: In a pan, heat oil, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.

Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.

In a microwave-safe bowl, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Microwave for 1 minute.
Add chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Microwave for 2-3 minutes, stirring in between.
Stir in coriander powder and microwave for another minute.
Add chopped tomatoes, diced bell pepper (capsicum), and cubed paneer. Microwave for 5-6 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Sprinkle garam masala and salt. Microwave for another 2 minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Microwave Kadhai Paneer.
In a microwave-safe bowl, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Microwave for 1 minute.
Add chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Microwave for 2-3 minutes, stirring in between.
Stir in turmeric powder and microwave for another minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and microwave for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add chopped okra (bhindi), red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Microwave for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Microwave Bhindi Masala.
In a blender, combine coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chilies, ginger, and garlic to make a green paste.
In a bowl, mix the green paste, yogurt, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt to form a marinade.
Coat the paneer cubes with the marinade and let it sit for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Thread the marinated paneer onto skewers and place them on a baking tray.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until the paneer is cooked and has a tandoori look.
Garnish with lemon wedges and serve Tandoori Paneer in Green Masala.

ingredients: 2 cups broccoli florets, steamed and mashed
methods: In a bowl, combine steamed and mashed broccoli, mashed boiled potatoes, grated cheese, gram flour (besan), cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
Mix well to form a dough.
Divide the mixture into small portions and shape them into koftas (balls).
Heat oil in a deep frying pan and deep fry the koftas until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove from the oil and drain excess oil on paper towels.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Broccoli Kofta.
Cook macaroni pasta in boiling salted water according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a saucepan, melt the butter, add milk, and grated cheese. Stir until the cheese is melted and the sauce is creamy.
Add cooked macaroni pasta and toss to coat in the cheese sauce.
Season with black pepper powder and salt to taste.
Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve Cheese Macaroni.

ingredients: 2 cups spinach leaves, blanched and pureed
methods: For Koftas:
In a mixing bowl, combine chopped fenugreek leaves (methi), gram flour (besan), cumin seeds, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt.
Add a little water at a time to make a firm dough.
Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into koftas (balls).
Heat oil in a deep frying pan and deep fry the koftas until they are golden brown and crispy. Remove from the oil and drain excess oil on paper towels.
For Gravy:
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates.
Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add pureed spinach leaves and simmer for a few minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve Methi Kofta in Spinach Gravy.
In a mixing bowl, combine boiled chickpeas (kabuli chana), chopped onion, chopped tomato, chopped cucumber, boiled and diced potatoes, and chopped green chilies.
Add chaat masala, cumin powder, red chili powder, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Kabuli Chana Chaat.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn translucent.

In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour (besan) with water to make a smooth batter.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Let them splutter.
Add chopped green chilies and turmeric powder. Sauté for a minute.
Slowly pour the gram flour batter into the pan while stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Cook the mixture on medium heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens and becomes smooth.
Season with salt and continue to cook for a few more minutes.
Garnish with chopped fresh coriander and serve Pittla.

Serve with a dollop of butter.
